intro: Deuterocohnia meziana subsp. carmineoviridiflora, commonly known as the carmine-green flowering cushion plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Restionaceae. It is native to the Andes Mountains of South America, particularly in regions of Ecuador and Peru. This perennial plant forms dense, low-growing mats with compact, succulent leaves that are typically green to reddish in color. Its flowers are small, clustered, and often display a mix of carmine and green hues, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
